name: InterContinental Amstel Amsterdam

reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite for four nights towards the end of March. The room was excellent, with a real coffee machine, state of the art Philips TV and genuine soak bath. The bed was very comfortable and easily accommodated a roll a way bed. The room was serviced every morning during breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities, but reduced staffing

reviews.text: However the service has deteriorated (we stayed here four years ago). Breakfast was very poor because the staff lacked experienced. On two of the four morning they did not manage to serve the eggs we had ordered, we were not offered toast, and getting coffee, milk and butter was a bit of a battle every day. There were very few guests, but we still had to wait because tables had not been re-set. The buffet was good, and of course the setting is excellent. We saw most of the breakfast staff under taking other roles in the hotel during the day (i.e. bell boy) and so it is reasonable to assume that the use of untrained staff was the cause of the problem. It is also fair to point out that the staff tried very hard to please, they just gave us the impression that they had not served in a restaurant before.
reviews.title: Perfect oasis

reviews.text: The minibar was not re-stocked during our stay, and room service could not provide a price list for the mini bar. For much of the day the concierge desk was staffed by a bell boy, who could do little more than give out leaflets.
reviews.title: On Fire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very quiet, as is Amsterdam at the moment, and the service may be better when demand picks up in the summer. This may be a temporary problem before summer staff are hired. On the other hand the rooms were not offered at a discount rate so we should not expect the hotel to be run on a skeleton staff.
reviews.title: Truly first class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole I would therefore give this hotel a miss until the there are some reports that the service problems have been solved. I would be reluctant to pay the price to stay here out of the main tourist season. Pity really because the rooms have been equipped to a very high standard, and the hotel exudes calls.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful experience. Being right on the river really gave us a taste of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In fact we spent an entire afternoon laying on the chaise lounges outside the spa watching the boat traffic go up and down the Amstel---a very entertaining experience. A nice location in walking distance of many sights.
reviews.title: good value and a delight in every way

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and elegant and the concierge very helpful
reviews.title: The perfect hotel

reviews.text: The staff are extremely helpful and professional. The hotel manager is very nice, friendly On arrival we checked in Hotel and warmly greeted with a welcome drink .Our room was clean and comfortable,the decor was lovely.The location of the hotel is great. Breakfast is absolutely delicious with many choices. You will not be disappointed when staying here. It’s incredibly good value for money and a delight in every way.
reviews.title: beautiful service but old fashioned rooms - not in a good way

reviews.text: This was a five-star hotel where you could "trust" the five star status - everything was perfect: room; food; service- somewhere you can truly relax and enjoy the art museums of the Dutch capital.
reviews.title: Pure class and wonderful

reviews.text: Loved this hotel, it's got a wow factor you don't get in many hotels
reviews.title: Excellent hotel-maybe a little pricey?

reviews.text: Service was typical of good 5 star hotels,
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Only downside is it's a little too far away from the main attractions
reviews.title: Great hotel in quiet canalside location

reviews.text: Only negative is maybe the price tag?
reviews.title: Excellent in all respects

reviews.text: A 2 night stay during the hottest days of June, but no problem - aircondition was quick and cooled down the room as the sun tried to melt the windows. I booked a city view room and got a channel view one. Thanks. Stunning view! Lunch on the terrace - really good.
reviews.title: expensive - but lovely
Seeing Amsterdam
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing! Great service and location.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: The food is great. The bar on the lower level is very friendly with great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a first rate plus hotel on the water, One is led to their room and there is a fruit basket and the room is very unhotel-like. The bathroom was terrific. Everything about the room was first rate. It is a perfect hotel. Only one complaint: The restaurant is not geared for American tastes but that makes sense. I love this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here three times now and this time splurged on a River view suite which was enormous.
reviews.title: Honeymoon suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very expensive and has to be the best in Amsterdam. Its a classic Grand Hotel, that attracts an older, wealthy customer base. Its a 20 min walk at least from the centre and thats no bad thing these days. Got ripped off twice by taxi drivers changing the price once they knew where your staying. So get the hotel to book taxi's etc if you can
reviews.title: Elegant hotel in a lovely setting

reviews.text: We have stayed in various InterContinental hotels over the years, but the Amstel in Amsterdam is by far superior to all.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.text: Even with ongoing area construction along the river, the view was spectacular.
reviews.title: "Well - Dressed Tart"

reviews.text: The amenities and service by the staff of the hotel were first rate,
reviews.title: Nice hotel but grossly overpriced

reviews.text: And we were upgraded to a suite due to an oversight by the hotel regarding our Ambassador Club status; needless to say, we were the beneficiaries of that disconnect.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: It was a most enjoyable stay in the most elegant of hotels.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: First off, I would still recommend the Amstel and would most probably stay there on my next trip to Amsterdam but, sadly, it simply isn't as good as it was!
reviews.title: Still a luxury hotel but not quite as good as it was

reviews.text: This could partly be that I have become more spolt over the years but I did find the service a bit lack-lustre this trip, as if the hotel staff have lost their spark. There was little evidence of proactive service and quite often there wasn't a waiter around when you wanted one! I did wonder whether this was - at least in part - a result of the current economy: i.e. fewer customers, maybe fewer staff ?
reviews.title: Gorgeous, friendly, luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was fine, but rather cold and formulaic - there was simply no real engagement with us as human beings.
reviews.title: Amstel High Tea

reviews.text: The hotel itself is still grand and generally well-maintained, though I noticed that the red carpet on the steps leading up to the hotel entrance is looking rather scruffy. Also, we did find the lighting in the lifts was ridiculously low. I know these are old lifts harking back to a bygone (pre-electricity) era, but the lighting level was equivalent to a couple of candles - you could only see the lift buttons when the doors opened!
reviews.title: Tranquil hotel in a hectic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Junior Suite, which was a good size and the bathroom was excellent: large shower plus bath, separate room for the tolilet. Very good linens and a comfy bed. The swimming pool is immaculately kept and very clean.
reviews.title: Fairy place in pieceful part of city

reviews.text: i guess we all want a bit of luxury sometimes , there is no doubt that the amstel is a luxurious place to stay.
reviews.title: Ridiculously Expensive , Dangerous Car Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i didnt eat ther e because frankly i couldnt afford to...and to be honest even if i could afford to , id rather give my money to oxfam or some deserving cause and eat down the road where prices are more reasonable.

reviews.text: whatever youe views may be about whether disable drivers should have free parking..and its a matter that should be debated...even if you decide to stump up the 100 usd , 66 euros , 60 gbp for overnight parking DRIVE VERY VERY CAREFULLY.
reviews.title: We have stayed at many top hotels-this is one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in some effort , i suppose to stop those unwilling to pay to park at the side of the hotel , basically on the street....no obvious parking signs , nothing to indicate that you are parking up in a concierge contolled environment ..whatever that may mean.
reviews.title: Best Free Night Ever
Just fabulous!
reviews.text: Simply the best! Whenever I have to spend time in Amsterdam, I stay at this fabulous hotel. Granted, it is not cheap but you get your money's worth, be it for the friendliness of the staff, the beauty of the dining rooms right next to the river or the sumptuous bedrooms. The only small complaint concerns the choice of programs on the TV - I find it very poor, especially for businessmen (neither CNBC nor Bloomberg). But this is a minor matter compared to all that is right at this hotel - one of my favourites in the whole world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visitors often have an advantage over the local residents, for they get to try some of the best hotels in any given area; locals tend not to stay in local hotels for obvious reasons; we live here.
reviews.title: Amazing Amstel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But last weekend my partner and I decided to stay at Amsterdam’s Grande Dame Hotel – the Amstel Hotel – in which we have eaten and drunk many times over the years, for it is close to our Amsterdam apartment.
reviews.title: Great Luxury Hotel

reviews.text: Staying as a guest was just amazing; very sumptuous, great service – almost regal but never stuffy! Luggage was whisked straight from our car to the room – and we had a beautiful view of the River Amstel below – while we supped champagne cocktails in the bar.
reviews.title: Great luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was very civilized and the receptionist accompanied us to our room, and explained the usual workings.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Amsterdam

likes.liked: — Our stay was perfect that is how it should be :-)

reviews.text: The rooms are nicely decorated in dutch flavor, although they are not quite big - even the higher price rooms.
reviews.title: It's a Royal Palace

likes.liked: — Totally treated like royalty; the best of everything.
likes.disliked: — A bit away from the center of town.

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.text: The real highlight is the restaurant and the Spa on the lower level. They are on the same height as the Amstel River in front of the Hotel, so stunning views from the pool or from the breakfast are guaranteed.
Only thing that didn't work out quite fine was the wireless Internet connection. Their server crashed 3 times in 3 days, but they took it off the bill without discussion.
reviews.title: Traditional, professional hotel

likes.disliked: — bit of a walk from most things

reviews.text: What an incredible spectacular palace in the middle of an otherwise modest city. All advance arrangements via e-mail were promptly responded to, and were faithfully done. Upon arrival you are greeted as royalty, and it just keeps getting better. Every last detail is spectacular. Outstanding breakfast, bar, terrace, dining. Rooms, lobby, gym, pool are all out of this world. Rock star spotted at poolside (Iggy Pop). Staff at all levels treats you with the utmost courtesy and respect. No ripoffs or jacked up prices for tickets, reservations or taxis/limos. Complementary goodies galore upon arrival. It's on a quiet side of town, near a tram stop, easy walk to start shopping or dining. Fantastic and plentiful amenities by L'Occitane. Prices are appropriate for a 5-star hotel, and it's worth it here.
reviews.title: Beware!

likes.liked: — Rooms are large and very well furnished
likes.disliked: — Noise, smell, and attitude of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just stayed stayed three nights at the IC Amstel. What a wonderful hotel. We stayed at the hotel using Priority Club rewards Points, and ww were upgraded to an Executive Suite.
reviews.title: What a fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Our room was fantastic - antique furnishings - our room had a wonderful sitting area including a small library- partioned off sleeping area and had separate bath, toilet and shower areas.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were excellent and treated us as if we were royality.
reviews.title: First impressions go a long way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated on the Amstel. It is sited to the south east of the centre of the City. I would say it is about 35 minutes walk to central railway station. However there are some lovely canal walks from the hotel, and the main theatres and opera house are only a few minutes walk away. For example Cats was on at the theatre. Some of the main museums are nearby and if you dislike walking and don't want to take a taxi, one of the tram lines is very close to the hotel which we used to travel to Anne Franks House - cost 1.60 euros. There is also an underground station nearby which takes you directly to central Railway station (north) or to Amstredam arena (Home of Ajax) in the South.
reviews.title: one of the better options in Amsterdam
Sheer Opulence
reviews.text: The hotel offers an airport collection service. The cost of this service is 101 Euros each way (75 Euros if a loyality club member)

Beautiful hotel located by the river. Staff very friendly and took time to show me the room (only experienced this before with Gritti Palace in Venice). I was upgraded to the river view room even without any status (rarely use IHG). Room is relatively small by American standard, but ok with just one person. Bathroom has separate shower room (bath tub in the main bathroom). L'Occitane toiletries. Hotel is a little far from city center attractions, but within 20 to 30 min walk along the river to the museums (Rijks, Van Gogh etc). If you have the Amsterdam card, the Blue Boat canal cruise included in the card is also very close to the museum area. On my way back from the museums I stopped over at the Heineken Experience and had a good time.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, superb view

reviews.text: It doesnt get any better really. Definitely a top notch hotel in every respect. We used our points to stay and loved it. Very quaint 19c styling. We were only here for a few nights, but would highly recommend to anyone. Using points only made it better. We walked from the train station and it was about a 25 minute walk. Airport was about the same by taxi....we did both!
reviews.title: Great hotel....excellent staff....beautiful area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is already for many years the top of hotels in Amsterdam. It's not modern, hip & stylish..... But it's classique, the service is very good and you really get the 5 star deluxe feeling. The butlers, valet, breakfast, rooms, swimming pool..... all seems perfect. A must go is restaurant La Rive - fine dining and nice service as well. Lovely dishes and really a 2 star Michelin address @ the Netherlands.
reviews.title: Classique, beautiful and fine dining @ La Rive Restaurant **

reviews.text: After several stays at truly dreadful hotels in Amsterdam, I returned to the Amstel, and was very pleased that little had changed. Indeed, while it is not cheap, I believe the prices are more in line with reality now than they were a few years ago. The decor is over-the-top classic in many ways, but this fits the historic building well. The location is lovely, with canal views presumably from many of the rooms, and it is remarkably quiet. The service is casual but efficient. The exception to this is breakfast, which is remarkably out of sync with everything else in the hotel: the service is uneven (one waiter is wonderful and helpful, one is surly, the other gossips loudly within earshot of diners), and the buffet spread is dull (as a guest at the table next to mine said: they can't do better than this in the best hotel in Holland?). That aside, I would recommend the Amstel as the best hotel to stay in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Still the best hotel in Amsterdam

reviews.text: Tucked along a canal with classic rooms, and tremendous service this place will not disappoint. The Consierge may be the best I have encountered at any hotel. The interiors are historic yet warm and the staff goes out of their way toe ensure satisfaction. Don't miss tea in the lounge off of the lobby. Great place for business people as the rooms work.
reviews.title: Classic charmer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just echoing the statements below: this hotel has old world charm, amazing service and every element of luxury one could hope for. The canal side location is used to great effect in the lounge, restaurant and bars. The semi-private lift to the suites is another great feature.
reviews.title: Without a doubt one of the best in Amsterdam

likes.liked: — sumptious luxury and attention to detail
likes.disliked: — a bit too far out of the action

reviews.text: The only drawback for me was the location. I prefer to be a bit closer into the more pedestrian areas. Yes the tram service is excellent and there are always taxis outside of the hotel but its not quite the same as walking out into the hustle and bustle of city life.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in need of refurbishment

reviews.text: All in all, this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in but in the future, I would pick either the SAS Radisson or the American Hotel when choosing luxury accomodations in Amsterdam based on their more central location.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is nice even if a bit outside of the action. The doorman is always at hand and friendly. Check-in -seated- is prompt and courteous. Most, not to say all, the staff members are nice and ready to help. The room, actually an Executive Suite, is nicely furnished as is the bathroom. The overall feel is really nice but it lacks modern amenities for an hotel of this class : MP3 docks, flat screens in all rooms, fresh flowers, welcome amenities like chocolates. At more than 5000 € per night, one would expect this kind of extra luxury the Amstel never provides despite this stay being my third stay. Overall a good and reliable option at a cost.
reviews.title: Loved the Amsterl, Just One Hitch.

likes.liked: — The location, The Food and The Interior of the room

reviews.text: I wanted a great hotel in Amsterdam with a pool for a leisure stay. The Amstel was the most fantastic place to stay; cost an arm and a leg but worth it if you can afford it. Great room, food, service, nothing at all to complain about.
reviews.title: Not so good anymore.

likes.liked: — Far away from the busy city centre.
likes.disliked: — Unfriendly attitude from the hotel staff.

description: Since the day the doors opened in 1867, InterContinental Amstel Amsterdam has been revered the world over for its palatial grandeur and residential warmth. Located where the financial, cultural and shopping districts converge, the hotel is a short walk from the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Spiegelkwartier and the Royal CarrÃ© Theatre. The Anne Frank House and the 14th-century Begijnhof are easy to reach by public transport or taxi.
